page.title: 08WORKING AT LOWER HIRST FARM
page.content: We buy and fatten beasts before we sell them at about 17-18 months at Bakewell, Doncaster & Penistone markets. This year Dad has about 30 beasts inside & he feeds them on a mixture of corn, molasses & minerals. He grinds & mixes it himself & uses the tractor to work the grinder. The cattle are allowed to roam free in the barn & need between 6 & 9 weeks to fatten. Farmers have to be careful corn fed cattle don't become bloated. Dad has about 30 heifers outside to fatten. Dad tries to count them every day. They move around the fields but we can walk to them. Between June & October grass fed beasts sell better than corn fed ones. Dad says that corn fed beasts have a whiter fat than grass fed ones. I want to be a calf dealer when I grow up.
